page.title: 11EDUCATION IN WEST CAMBS.
page.content:
Neither Stow Longa nor Catworth has a village school, but special buses are provided to take pupils to schools in other towns and villages. Children between the ages of five and eleven attend the village primary schools at Brington, Spaldwick or Kimbolton, travelling a maximum of 6 kilometres. For their secondary education, pupils transfer to the larger comprehensive schools, farther away at Huntingdon or St. Neots.
A significant minority of parents choose to send their children to Kimbolton School, an independent fee- paying school for children between the ages of eight and eighteen. Some families have moved into the area to live near Kimbolton School, a trend which has inflated house prices.
